long: Meaning: perhaps properly, to "arrange"; but used figuratively (of words), to "speak"; rarely (in a destructive sense) to "subdue".  Usage: answer, appoint, bid, command, commune, declare, destroy, give, name, promise, pronounce, rehearse, say, speak, be spokesman, subdue, talk, teach, tell, think, use (entreaties), utter, × well, × work.  Source: a primitive root;
